instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v only
threads.message: Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in that does not appear to be liquid damaged , but it was worked on before. It has 5v 0.01a on all 4 ports. Found <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground through <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>. Replaced that and the short was gone but still have the same issue with 5v 0.01a. PPBUS is 0v and <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is also 0v and not shorted to ground. Wondering if I should continue on this or is this a dead CPU due to shorted <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v only
threads.message:
Very likely dead CPU, because of overvoltage.
Compare exact ohm value on CPU coils with a good board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v only
threads.message: Yea I compared values on the CPU coils with another board and they are lower than normal. CPU is dead on this one. Thanks
